DOC.brief_summary: With study researcher evaluate effect GLB intervention weight loss , chronic disease indicator self-perceived function well-being active duty population . The purpose study examine effectiveness GLB program [ compare two currently available program , Fitness Improvement Program ( FIP ) Better Body Better Life ( BBBL ) program ] , follow health indicator : improvement individual physical fitness measure change abdominal circumference , weight physical activity ; decrease risk associate chronic disease measure change lipid HbA1c level ; improvement self-perceived function well-being measure RAND 36 Item Short Form Health Survey ( RAND SF- 36 ) . In addition , researcher seek obtain feedback program participant .
DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Group Lifestyle Balance Class Military Population
DOC.detailed_description: Many active duty personnel struggle weight gain become overweight course active duty service . This lead difficulty maintain fitness standard limit ability fully function perform mission . In addition , may lead increase risk chronic disease development . Few publish study exist evaluate intervention aim weight loss chronic disease prevention active duty population . The Group Lifestyle Balance ( GLB ) program show effective facilitating weight loss reduce chronic disease risk civilian population . However , effectiveness class prevent chronic illness , facilitate weight loss , increase physical activity promote perception improve functioning well-being study active duty population . The purpose study examine effectiveness GLB program compare currently available Fitness Improvement Program ( FIP ) Better Body Better Life ( BBBL ) follow health indicator : individual physical fitness measure change weight , abdominal circumference minute engage physical activity ; change risk associate chronic disease measure change lipid HbA1c level ; change self-perception function well-being measure RAND SF-36 questionnaire . This quantitative randomize control intervention study determine effect GLB class physical indicator fitness , disease risk overall perception functional health well-being active duty population , compare outcomes FIP intervention ( care usual ) newly implement BBBL intervention currently offer Airmen . This study conduct David Grant Medical Center ( DGMC ) , Travis AFB , California .
DOC.criteria: • An active duty member USAF Have least one follow condition : An abdominal circumference 35 inch men 31.5 inch woman BMI 25 kg/m2 Are willing commit weekly 1 hour class 12 week monthly 1 hour class additional 3 month • Women pregnant breastfeed Participants within 8 month Permanent Change Station deployment Anyone restrict participate moderate activity equivalent brisk walk Taking lipidlowering glucoselowering medication Anyone medical reason calorierestricted diet
